parseTimeStamp

public static java.util.Date parseTimeStamp(java.lang.String timeStamp)
                                     throws java.text.ParseException
Convert a time stamp from getTimeStamp into the equivalent Date object.

Parameters:
timeStamp - A date created in the concise format TIMESTAMP_FORMAT returned by getTimeStamp().
Returns:
The Date equivalent to the time stamp.
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - When the string is in the wrong format.

getLongTimeStamp

public static java.lang.String getLongTimeStamp()
Return a concise string that can be added as a timestamp to filenames. Includes milliseconds. Guaranteed to return a unique value each time it is called.

Returns:
String in format TIMESTAMP_LONG_FORMAT.

replaceAll

public static java.lang.String replaceAll(java.lang.String x,
                                          java.lang.String y,
                                          java.lang.String s)
Replaces all occurences in string s of string x with string y. Stole from com.lgc.gpr.util.XmlUtil.replaceAll.

Parameters:
x - string to be replaced.
y - string replacing each occurence of x.
s - string containing zero or more x to be replaced.
Returns:
string s with all x replaced with y.

breakLines

public static java.lang.String breakLines(java.lang.String s,
                                          int maxchars)
Break lines at convenient locations and indent if lines are too long. Try to break at word boundaries, but resort to breaking in the middle of a word with a backslash if necessary.

Parameters:
s - String that needs to be broken.
maxchars - The maximum number of characters to use per line.
Returns:
String with newlines and indentations included as necessary. The result will always have a final newline

ns

public static java.lang.String ns(double d)
Convert a double to a string appropriate for writing to a file. Larger numbers are treated as integers. This name is short and cryptic because it appears so often on a single line. (Stands for Number String.)

Parameters:
d - Convert this double to a String.
Returns:
String suitable for a human to read, with acceptable precision.

nsf

public static java.lang.String nsf(double d)
Converts a double to a string. The number is initally formatted with String.format("%g",d) which gives 6 significant digits of precision. Then the string is cleaned up by removing trailing zeros to the right of the decimal point, and by suppressing the decimal point if it is followed only by zeros. Finally, any algebraic sign preceeding zero is discarded. This name is short and cryptic because it appears so often on a single line (think "Number String Format").

Parameters:
d - Convert this double to a string.
Returns:
String suitable for a human to read, with acceptable precision.

getUniqueDate

public static java.util.Date getUniqueDate()
Get a date for a timestamp, and avoid any previous dates by adding a millisecond if necessary.

Returns:
unique Date
